RT @NatashaFatah: Forgotten on the Covid Frontline

We talk about doctors, nurses, teachers - but people like @RechevBrowne are the forgottâ€¦

Pfizer's antiviral COVID pill (Paxlovid) will be approved in Canada imminently.

Fantastic news.

We can put this to good use.

2 years ago we looked at the potential for global spread of COVID via commercial air travel.

It wasn't clear to what extent human-to-human transmission could occur at the time this was published.

We've come a long way (vax, therapuetics, epi, etc), but still have much to learn. https://t.co/fu1ZgEwIBD

Important to distinguish between safe & safer.

COVID mitigation efforts (vax, mask, ventilation, RATs etc) create safer indoor environments.

Outbreaks still occur in settings with universal N95, vax, hepa filters. We can reduce (not eliminate) the frequency & size of outbreaks.

This study demonstrates the benefit of vaccination in those who recover from a COVID infection (fewer symptomatic infections many months later), while still quantifying the real protection of infection-derived immunity - in Alpha, Delta & Omicron eras.

https://t.co/XW7CTYqFZC https://t.co/mvF0o5jXPf
The discrepancy between online rhetoric and on-the-ground issues has never been greater than at any other point of the pandemic.
RT @ScienceMagazine: As #vaccines for #COVID19 are distributed all across the globe, we look back at this data visualization from 2017 thatâ€¦

3 covid vaccine doses help. So what's next?

Unclear, but maybe:
*Nothing?
*A booster for those with risk factors for severe illness?
*Yearly vaccine (like influenza)?
*Infrequent boosters?

Regardless, any future vax program should be guided by high-quality clinical trials.
